fields.headline: Where there's muck
fields.bodyText: As a magazine editor you are sometimes offered interesting freebies: ballet or rugby tickets, flowers from a fashion PR, or perhaps a trip somewhere exotic. But the most extraordinary gift I have ever been given now sits humming on the Observer Magazine Organic allotment. When biodynamic farmer Roger Pauli answered our plea for manure, we had not really factored in the near 300-mile round trip to his exquisite farm in Stourton, Staffordshire, the torrential rain, the wheel-buckling load, the smell on the slow drive home. But now thanks to the generosity of Roger and family; his share farmers, the other Roger and Sarah (not forgetting Jewel, Lady Smith and their other beautiful biodynamic cows), we are in proud possession of the holy grail of humus: perfectly rotted down two-year-old cow manure loaded with biodynamic preparations and thrumming with life to pass onto our soil and crops. Now if only we hadn't forgotten the half-hour-old organic eggs
